alert.note: Alert for Inland Southern Brevard; Mainland Southern Brevard; Osceola; Southern Brevard Barrier Islands (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 1:54PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Brevard and east central Osceola Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 153 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Viera, or near Rockledge. This storm was nearly stationary with perhaps a slow drift to the east. This storm too was building westward into eastern Osceola County as the sea breeze ventures inland. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Melbourne, Rockledge, Cocoa Beach, Satellite Beach and Camp Holly Fish Camp. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
